case_vignette: A 66-YEAR-OLD FEMALE WITH PAST MEDICAL HISTORY OF RIGHT BREAST CANCER TREATED WITH RADIATION PRESENTS WITH A SLOWLY GROWING MASS ON THE RIGHT BREAST. SHE STATES THE SPOT INITIALLY BEGAN AS A SMALL BRUISE THEN PROGRESSIVELY ENLARGENED OVER THE PAST FEW MONTHS AND NOW SPONTANEOUSLY BLEEDS. EXAMINATION REVEALS A VIOLACEOUS, RED EXOPHYTIC THICK NODULE ON THE RIGHT BREAST. AN EXCISIONAL BIOPSY REVEALS ATYPICAL PLEOMORPHIC ENDOTHELIAL CELLS LINING ILL-DEFINED VASCULAR SPACES AND PROMINENT HEMORRHAGE.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a slowly growing mass on my right breast that started as a small bruise and now it spontaneously bleeds.
Have you noticed any changes in the skin around the mass, like redness or dimpling?
Yes, the skin around the mass is violaceous and red.
Do you have any personal or family history of breast cancer?
Yes, I have a personal history of right breast cancer that was treated with radiation.
Have you had any recent imaging studies like a mammogram or ultrasound for this mass?
You didn't provide details on that, so I can't say if I've had any recent imaging studies.
Have you experienced any weight loss, fatigue, or other systemic symptoms recently?
You didn't mention those symptoms, so I haven't experienced any weight loss, fatigue, or other systemic symptoms.
Final Diagnosis: Angiosarcoma of the breast
